itemDescription: British gardener, one of the two first women hired at Kew Gardens in 1896

wikipedia_page.main: Alice Hutchins (c. 1870 – 24 January 1944) was one of the two first women gardeners hired at Kew Gardens in 1896.

response: As Director, in 1896 Dyer appointed the first women gardeners at Kew, Annie Gulvin and Alice Hutchins.
In January 1896 Gulvin was appointed, with Alice Hutchins, by William Thiselton-Dyer, then Director of the Royal Botanic Gardens as the first women gardeners at Kew.

The first woman principal was Fanny Wilkinson from 1904 – 1916 and 1921 – 1922. Two of the college's first graduates, Annie Gulvin and Alice Hutchins became the first women gardeners at Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew.  Later graduates were Brenda Colvin and Sylvia Crowe. Frances Micklethwait was Principal at Swanley in 1922, where she had once been a student. She had previously been a chemist at University College, London.
